meanings.definition: To make corrections or improvements to (a text)
meanings.sent1: She is emendating her essay to fix any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher spent hours emendating the students' papers.
meanings.sent3: The writer couldn't stop emendating, even after the final draft was due.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous emendating turned the rough draft into a polished masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: With each emendating session, the document became more refined and clear.

meanings.definition: The act of making corrections or improvements to (a text)
meanings.sent1: His emendating of the manuscript greatly improved its readability.
meanings.sent2: The editor's emendating skills were highly valued in the publishing industry.
meanings.sent3: The emendating process can be tedious but is essential for quality writing.
meanings.sent4: The emendating of the novel transformed it into a bestseller.
meanings.sent5: The emendating of the report revealed hidden errors and enhanced its impact.
